japanese:
ふー、いい買い物したぁ。
これでお土産は問題なーし！
translation:
Phew, I made some good deals.
I have all the souvenirs I need!

japanese:
私も！
学校の友達用の、バッチリ買えたよ。
translation:
Me too!
I was able to buy something perfect
for my school friends.

japanese: お父さんへのお土産って誰か買った？
translation: Did anyone buy a souvenir for Dad?

japanese:
はい、琉球ガラスのペーパーウェイトを買いました。
お仕事でも使えそうですから。
translation:
Yes, I bought him a ryukyu glass paperweight.
It seems like something he could use for work too.

japanese: そっかー、やっぱりペーパーウェイトにしたんだ。
translation: I see, you decided to go with a paperweight after all.

japanese:
（気付けば、あっという間に集合時間。
　二乃をリードしてやろうと思っていたのに
　なにもできていないのはどうしてなんだ……）
translation:
(Before I knew it, it was time to meet up.
 I wanted to lead Nino,
 but I haven't done anything...)

japanese:
（このままじゃ、
　二乃に男を見せてやることもできない。
　くそっ、情けない！）
translation:
(At this rate, I won't be able to show Nino
 the kind of man I am.
 Dammit, how pathetic!)

japanese: ねえ、ちょっといい？
translation: Hey, can I talk to you?

japanese: なに？
translation: What?

japanese:
さっき、近くにシーサー作りの体験が
できるところを見つけたのよ。
translation:
I found a place nearby
where you can try your hand at making shisa.

japanese:
時間もそんなにかからないみたいだし、
行ってみない？
translation:
It doesn't seem to take that much time either.
Do you want to go?

japanese: （……シーサー作り？）
translation: (Making shisa?)

japanese:
シーサーって玄関とか屋根にいるのだよね？
あれって作れるの？
translation:
Shisa are the lion-dogs
that are often placed at entrances
or on roofs, right? Can you actually make them?

japanese:
ええ。
もちろん、大きな物じゃなくて
手のひらサイズみたいだけど。
translation:
Yeah.
Of course, they're not very big,
they're about the size of your palm.

japanese: ちょっと楽しそう。
translation: That sounds like fun.

japanese: みんなで作ったら思い出にもなるよね。
translation: If we all made them, that'd be a great memory.

japanese: ええ、私も賛成です。
translation: Yes, I agree.

japanese: 風太郎はどうかしら？
translation: How about you, Futaro?

japanese:
もちろん賛成だ！
俺が生きのいいシーサーを作り上げてやるぜ！
translation:
Of course, I'm in!
I'll make the most lively shisa ever!

japanese: 生きのいいシーサーってなんですか。
translation: What's a lively shisa?

japanese: 張り切ってるのは伝わってきたけど……。
translation: I can tell you're enthusiastic, Futaro...

japanese:
フータローって、
こういう物作りがそんなに好きだった？
translation: But, did you like making things like this?

japanese:
ま、まあな！
自分で作品を作り上げるのは楽しいじゃないか！
translation:
Y-yeah!
Isn't it fun to create something on your own?

japanese:
ふふ、そうね。
それじゃ行きましょ！
translation:
Teehee, it is.
Right, let's go then!

japanese: よし……。
translation: Alright...

japanese:
（ここで二乃に俺の美的センスを
　見せてやろうじゃないかっ！）
translation:
(Now's my chance to show Nino
 my aesthetic sense!)

japanese:
（リードするとは違うかもしれない！
　男を見せるとも違うだろうが、
　もうこれは俺の意地とプライドの問題だ！！）
translation:
(I'm not even leading her!
 And this isn't about showing her the kind of man I am.
 NO! This is a matter of my pride and dignity!!)

japanese:
上杉君？
なにを怖い顔をしているんですか？
translation:
Uesugi-kun?
Why do you have such a scary expression?

japanese:
気合いの現れだ。
見てろよ、最高の一品を作り上げてやる！
translation:
It's a sign of my determination.
Just watch, I'll make the best one there is!

japanese: は、はあ……。
translation: *sigh*

japanese:
（さっそくシーサー作り体験の店へ向かい、
　手続きを済ませる）
translation:
(We headed straight to the shisa-making shop
 and completed the necessary procedures.)

japanese:
（シーサーは１時間ほどでできあがり、
　持ち帰りもできるということだった）
translation:
(It turned out that the shisa could be made in about an hour 
 and taken home with us.)

japanese:
（店員の丁寧な手ほどきを受けつつ、
　みんな、それぞれ自分なりのシーサーを
　作り上げていったのだが――）
translation:
(While receiving careful guidance from the staff,
 everyone made their own shisa in their own way%p-2;――%p;)

japanese:
楽しかったですね。
こんな簡単に作れるとは思っていませんでした。
translation:
That was fun.
I didn't think they would be so easy to make.

japanese: ねえねえ、五月のシーサーはどんな感じ？
translation: Hey, hey, what does your shisa look like, Itsuki?

japanese:
私のはこれです。
お手本通りに作ったつもりですが、どうでしょう？
translation:
This is mine.
I tried to make it just like the model,
but what do you think?

japanese:
おー！　上手だね。
お店で売ってるシーサーみたい。
translation:
Wow! You did a great job.
It looks just like the shisa sold in the store.

japanese: うん、お手本そっくり。
translation: Yes, exactly like it.

japanese:
ありがとうございます。
一花のシーサーはどんな感じになったんですか？
translation:
Thanks.
What kind of shisa did you make, Ichika?

japanese:
じゃーん！
名付けて、寝そべりシーサーでーす。
translation:
Ta-da!
Introducing the sprawling shisa.

japanese: あはは、本当に寝転がってる！
translation: Ahaha, it's really lying down!

japanese: すごく一花らしい。
translation: That's so you, Ichika.

japanese:
へへー、いい感じでしょ？
私の安眠を守ってくれるシーサーにしようと思ってさ。
translation:
Hehe, it's nice, isn't it?
I thought I'd make a shisa
that would protect my sleep.

japanese: 寝てたら守ってくれないでしょ。
translation: If it's sleeping, it won't protect you, right?

japanese:
ですね。
この子は一花と一緒に寝てしまいそうです。
translation:
That's true.
This little one seems like
it would end up sleeping with Ichika.

japanese: あらら、添い寝シーサーになっちゃったか。
translation: Oh my, it turned into a cuddling shisa, huh?

japanese: ねえ、三玖のはどんなの？
translation: Hey, how's yours, Miku?

japanese:
私のはこれ。
甲冑を着せてみた。
translation:
Here's mine.
I tried putting armor on it.

japanese: わお、これはまた個性的だなー。
translation: Wow, this is quite unique.

japanese: いかにも魔除けという感じの仕上がりですね。
translation: It really feels like it's a charm.

japanese:
五月さんたち、五つ子だけど
できたのは全然違う感じになってるんだ。
translation:
Even though you're quintuplets,
the ones you made turned out completely different.

japanese: そもそも好みも全然違うもの。
translation: Well, our preferences are completely different.

japanese: 二乃さんはどんなの？
translation: How about yours, Nino-san?

japanese:
私は、お手本よりもデフォルメして作ってみたわ。
どうかしら。
translation:
I tried making mine more deformed than the model.
What do you think?

japanese:
わあ、可愛い～！
こういうキャラいそう！
translation:
Wow, it's so cute!
This could actually be an existing character!

japanese: うん、このままご当地キャラにしてもいいくらい。
translation: Yeah, it could even be a local mascot.

japanese:
グッズにしたら売れそう。
私なら買っちゃうなー。
translation:
The merch for that would sell well.
I'd buy it.

japanese:
な、なに、みんなで褒めて。
なんだか気持ち悪いわ。
translation:
Wh-what's with all the compliments?
It's making me uncomfortable.

japanese: それだけ二乃のセンスがいいんですよ。
translation: That's how good your taste is, Nino.

japanese: そうそう、素直に褒められておきなって。
translation: Yeah, we aren't kidding you right now.

japanese: ……あ、ありがと。
translation: Th-thanks.

japanese:
ねえ、風太郎は？
どんなシーサーになったの？
translation:
And, what about you, Futaro?
What kind of shisa did you make?
Ooh...

japanese:
フータロー君、ずっと黙ってるじゃない？
もったいぶるほど自信があるのか、それとも……。
translation:
Futaro-kun, you've been quiet this whole time.
Do you have so much confidence in your skills?
Are you gonna show off...?

japanese: あ、これはやっちゃったほう？
translation: Ah, you messed it up, didn't you.

japanese: ……ほら。
translation: Hey...

japanese: これは……。
translation: This is...

japanese: 別に、笑いたければ笑っていいぞ。
translation: I mean, if you wanna laugh, just laugh.

japanese:
いえ、そんな！
あなたなりに努力して作った物を
笑うなんてしません！
translation:
How could I!
I wouldn't dare laugh at something
you worked hard to make in your own way!

japanese:
（くっ……。
　五月の全力のフォローが逆につらい！）
translation:
(Ugh...
 Itsuki's full-on support is actually painful!)

japanese: なんていうか、これはこれで味があるし？
translation: I mean, this has its own unique style, right?

japanese: きっと、こういうのがシュールレアリスム。
translation: I'm sure this is what they call surrealism.

japanese: お前、意味も知らずに言ってるよな。
translation: You're saying that without even knowing the meaning.

japanese: じゃあキュビズムで。
translation: Then, cubism.

japanese: じゃあじゃねぇよ！
translation: Stop enumerating art movements like that!

japanese: 無理しないで、お手本通りに作ればよかったのに。
translation:
You should've just followed the example
without forcing anything.

japanese:
……そうだな。
ちょっと張り切りすぎた。
translation:
Yeah, you're right.
I got a little too carried away.

japanese:
（なんとかセンスを見せようとして
　迷いすぎて方向性を失ってしまった。
　そして袋小路に行き着いた結果がこれだ）
translation:
(I was trying to show off my sense of style,
 but ended up getting lost in the process,
 and this is the result of hitting a dead end.)

japanese: （二乃は……）
translation: (What's Nino thinking about that...)

japanese: まあ、そういうところが風太郎らしいわ。
translation: Well, that's just how you are, Futaro.

japanese: （俺らしい……）
translation: (How I am...)

japanese: （俺らしいってなんだ？）
translation: (What is she trying to tell me?)

japanese:
（二乃をリードもできない、
　勉強以外まるでダメな俺……）
translation:
(I can't even lead Nino, and I'm completely useless
 at anything other than studying...)

japanese:
正直、この先お前を
ガッカリさせることばかりだろうな。
translation:
To be honest,
I think I'll just disappoint you from now on.

japanese: 私が好きになったのは、そういうフー君なんだもの。
translation: I fell in love with you because you're you, Fu-kun.

japanese:
（もしかして、そんな俺を
　二乃は仕方ないと受け入れている……？）
translation:
(Could it be that Nino
 has just accepted me for who I am...?)

japanese: 風太郎？　どうしたの？
translation: Futaro? What's wrong?

japanese: ……いや、なんでもない。
translation: No, nothing.
